query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Guardando nel suo Figlio con l’Amore 2 che l’uno e l’altro etternalmente spira, 3 lo primo e ineffabile Valore
query.error: **English:** 1 Looking into His Son with the Love 2 that the one and the other eternally breathe, 3 the first and ineffable Value
query.result: 1 Wlitigende on his Sunu ðurh ða Lufe 2 ðe ða an and ða oðer ecelice blæseð, 3 ðone ærestan and unsædlican Weorðscipe

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 quanto per mente e per loco si gira 5 con tant’ ordine fé, ch’esser non puote 6 sanza gustar di lui chi ciò rimira.
query.error: **English:** 4 as much as can be grasped by mind and place 5 with such order He made, that it cannot be 6 without tasting of Him who contemplates it.
query.result: 4 swa fela swa ðurh geðoht and ðurh stowe gæð 5 mid ði miclan gesceade geworhte, ðæt nis nateshwon meaht 6 butan ðæs Onsmeagunge ðe ðæt gesihð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Leva dunque, lettore, a l’alte rote 8 meco la vista, dritto a quella parte 9 dove l’un moto e l’altro si percuote;
query.error: **English:** 7 Rise up then, reader, with me to the high wheels, 8 your sight directed straight to that point 9 where one motion strikes the other;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 e lì comincia a vagheggiar ne l’arte 11 di quel maestro che dentro a sé l’ama, 12 tanto che mai da lei l’occhio non parte.
query.error: **English:** 10 and there begin to gaze with wonder at the art 11 of that master who loves it within himself, 12 so much that his eye never departs from it.
query.result: 10 and ðær ongin tó wundrigenne on ðære cræfte 11 ðæs wyrhta ðe híe lufoð innan him sylfum, 12 swá ðætte næfre his éage ne wícoð of híe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Vedi come da indi si dirama 14 l’oblico cerchio che i pianeti porta, 15 per sodisfare al mondo che li chiama.
query.error: **English:** 13 See how from there branches off 14 the oblique circle that carries the planets, 15 to satisfy the world that calls to them.
query.result: 13 Gesyhð þu hu ðanon sidðan cumað 14 se ymbhoga hring ðe ða tunglu bærð, 15 ðurh ðæs middangeardes men to gefremmanne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Che se la strada lor non fosse torta, 17 molta virtù nel ciel sarebbe in vano, 18 e quasi ogne potenza qua giù morta;
query.error: **English:** 16 That if their path were not twisted, 17 much virtue in heaven would be in vain, 18 and nearly every power down here would be dead;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 e se dal dritto più o men lontano 20 fosse ’l partire, assai sarebbe manco 21 e giù e sù de l’ordine mondano.
query.error: **English:** 19 and if the departure from the right path were more or less, 20 the order of the world would be much less, 21 both above and below.
query.result: 19 and gif ðæt rihte wære mare oððe læsse 20 on ðam todælende, ðonne wære swiðe lyt 21 and ufan and neoðan ðæs worldlican gesetnysse.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Or ti riman, lettor, sovra ’l tuo banco, 23 dietro pensando a ciò che si preliba, 24 s’esser vuoi lieto assai prima che stanco.
query.error: **English:** 22 Now you remain, reader, on your bench, 23 reflecting on what has been briefly tasted, 24 if you wish to be very happy before you are weary.
query.result: 22 Nu ðu ðe læfst, leof mon, on ðinum bence, 23 ðenceðe ðæs ðe ðu ær gehyrde, 24 gif ðu wære swiðe blide ær ðu sie wærig.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Messo t’ho innanzi: omai per te ti ciba; 26 ché a sé torce tutta la mia cura 27 quella materia ond’ io son fatto scriba.
query.error: **English:** 25 I have set it before you: now feed yourself on it; 26 for all my care is turned to that subject 27 from which I have become a scribe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Lo ministro maggior de la natura, 29 che del valor del ciel lo mondo imprenta 30 e col suo lume il tempo ne misura,
query.error: **English:** 28 The greatest minister of nature, 29 who imprints the world with the power of the heavens 30 and measures time with his light,
query.result: 28 Se mæsta wealdend ðære gesceaft, 29 se ðæs heofonlican mægnes middangeard gestaðolað 30 and mid his leohte ðone timan gemeteð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 con quella parte che sù si rammenta 32 congiunto, si girava per le spire 33 in che più tosto ognora s’appresenta;
query.error: **English:** 31 was turning, joined with that part which is remembered above, 32 through the coils in which he always appears more quickly; 33 and I was with him; but I did not notice the ascent,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 e io era con lui; ma del salire 35 non m’accors’ io, se non com’ uom s’accorge, 36 anzi ’l primo pensier, del suo venire.
query.error: **English:** 34 except as a man notices, before his first thought, the coming of something.
query.result: 34 and ic wæs mid him; ac ðæs upstiges 35 ne ongeat ic me, buton swa man geðenceð, 36 ær ðam forman geþance, his tocymes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 È Bëatrice quella che sì scorge 38 di bene in meglio, sì subitamente 39 che l’atto suo per tempo non si sporge.
query.error: **English:** 37 It is Beatrice who thus reveals herself 38 from good to better, so suddenly 39 that her action does not extend itself in time.
query.result: 37 Nis ðæt Beatrijs ðe ðus hire selfne 38 of gode to bettre swa swiðe awent, 39 ðæt hire weorc ðurh tíman ne stent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Quant’ esser convenia da sé lucente 41 quel ch’era dentro al sol dov’ io entra’mi, 42 non per color, ma per lume parvente!
query.error: **English:** 40 How dazzling must have been in itself 41 that which was within the sun where I entered, 42 not because of color, but because of light appearing!
query.result: 40 Hu ðæt wæs ða leohte ðurh hine sylfne 41 ðæt ðær wæs innan ðære sunnan ðær ic on eode, 42 na for hiwe, ac for leohte ðæt ðær wæs gesyne!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Perch’ io lo ’ngegno e l’arte e l’uso chiami, 44 sì nol direi che mai s’imaginasse; 45 ma creder puossi e di veder si brami.
query.error: **English:** 43 Therefore I call upon my intellect, art, and experience, 44 yet I could not describe it so that it could ever be imagined; 45 but it can be believed and desired to be seen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 E se le fantasie nostre son basse 47 a tanta altezza, non è maraviglia; 48 ché sopra ’l sol non fu occhio ch’andasse.
query.error: **English:** 46 And if our fantasies are lowly 47 in the face of such loftiness, it is no wonder; 48 for above the sun there has been no eye that has gone.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Tal era quivi la quarta famiglia 50 de l’alto Padre, che sempre la sazia, 51 mostrando come spira e come figlia.
query.error: **English:** 49 Such was there the fourth family 50 of the high Father, who always satisfies it, 51 showing how he breathes and how he begets.
query.result: 49 Swylc wæs ðær ðara feorðan mægð 50 ðæs hean Fæder, se ðe heo symle gefylð, 51 æteowde hu he blæwð and hu he acendeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 E Bëatrice cominciò: «Ringrazia, 53 ringrazia il Sol de li angeli, ch’a questo 54 sensibil t’ha levato per sua grazia».
query.error: **English:** 52 And Beatrice began: "Give thanks, 53 give thanks to the Sun of the angels, who has raised you to this 54 sensible world through his grace."
query.result: 52 And Bēatrice ongan: "Þanca, 53 þanca ðone Sunnan ðara engla, ðe ðe ðisne 54 gesewenlican gesceaft ðurh his gife forgeaf."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Cor di mortal non fu mai sì digesto 56 a divozione e a rendersi a Dio 57 con tutto ’l suo gradir cotanto presto,
query.error: **English:** 55 Never was the heart of a mortal 56 so disposed to devotion and to surrender to God 57 with all its desire so quickly,
query.result: 55 Næs næfre nanes mannes heorte swa gearo 56 to geornfulnesse and to Gode gecyrran 57 mid ealre his willan swa hraðe,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 come a quelle parole mi fec’ io; 59 e sì tutto ’l mio amore in lui si mise, 60 che Bëatrice eclissò ne l’oblio.
query.error: **English:** 58 as I became at those words; 59 and all my love was so focused on him, 60 that Beatrice was eclipsed in oblivion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Non le dispiacque; ma sì se ne rise, 62 che lo splendor de li occhi suoi ridenti 63 mia mente unita in più cose divise.
query.error: **English:** 61 She was not displeased; rather, she laughed so much 62 that the splendor of her smiling eyes 63 divided my unified mind into many parts.
query.result: 61 Ne hire ðæs ne ascunode; ac heo ðæs swa hloh 62 ðæt ðæs hire lixte ðara leomendra eagna 63 ðone mod geðeahte on ða manige healfe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Io vidi più folgór vivi e vincenti 65 far di noi centro e di sé far corona, 66 più dolci in voce che in vista lucenti:
query.error: **English:** 64 I saw more living and triumphant lightning bolts 65 making a center of us and a crown of themselves, 66 sweeter in voice than shining in appearance:
query.result: 64 Ic geseah ma folgor lifgende and sigefæste 65 wyrcan of us midde and of him sylfne corona, 66 swetran on stefne ðonne on gesyhðe leohte:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 così cinger la figlia di Latona 68 vedem talvolta, quando l’aere è pregno, 69 sì che ritenga il fil che fa la zona.
query.error: **English:** 67 thus we sometimes see the daughter of Latona 68 encircle herself, when the air is pregnant, 69 so that it retains the thread that makes the zone.
query.result: 67 swa we gesioð hwilum Latonan dohtor 68 ymbutan hire sylf clipian, ðonne lyft bið gebycged, 69 swa ðæt hit gehealde ðone fæðm ðe ða zone wyrceð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Ne la corte del cielo, ond’ io rivegno, 71 si trovan molte gioie care e belle 72 tanto che non si posson trar del regno;
query.error: **English:** 70 In the court of heaven, from which I have returned, 71 many joys are found, precious and beautiful, 72 so much so that they cannot be brought out of the kingdom;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 e ’l canto di quei lumi era di quelle; 74 chi non s’impenna sì che là sù voli, 75 dal muto aspetti quindi le novelle.
query.error: **English:** 73 and the song of those lights was of those joys; 74 whoever does not grow wings so that he may fly up there, 75 must await the news from here below in silence.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Poi, sì cantando, quelli ardenti soli 77 si fuor girati intorno a noi tre volte, 78 come stelle vicine a’ fermi poli,
query.error: **English:** 76 Then, singing thus, those burning suns 77 turned around us three times, 78 like stars close to the fixed poles.
query.result: 76 Þa, swa singende, ða hatan sunnan 77 him on ymb utan þrywa hwearfdon, 78 swa steorran on staðole fæste.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 donne mi parver, non da ballo sciolte, 80 ma che s’arrestin tacite, ascoltando 81 fin che le nove note hanno ricolte.
query.error: **English:** 79 They seemed to me ladies, not loosed from a dance, 80 but who stand still, listening silently, 81 until they have gathered the new notes.
query.result: 79 Hi wæron me gelice wif, na on wrixle, 80 ac swa swa ða ðe standað ða stillastan, 81 oððæt ða niwan stefna gehyrað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 E dentro a l’un senti’ cominciar: «Quando 83 lo raggio de la grazia, onde s’accende 84 verace amore e che poi cresce amando,
query.error: **English:** 82 And within one I heard a voice begin: "When 83 the ray of grace, by which true love is kindled 84 and which then grows by loving,
query.result: 82 And innan ðæm anum ic gehyrde ðone stefn onginnan: "Þonne 83 se leoma ðære gife, ðurh ðone bið soðfæst lufu onæled 84 and ðe ðonne weaxeð ðurh ðæt lufiende,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 multiplicato in te tanto resplende, 86 che ti conduce su per quella scala 87 u’ sanza risalir nessun discende;
query.error: **English:** 85 multiplied in you shines so brightly 86 that it leads you up that ladder 87 from which no one descends without ascending;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 qual ti negasse il vin de la sua fiala 89 per la tua sete, in libertà non fora 90 se non com’ acqua ch’al mar non si cala.
query.error: **English:** 88 who would deny you the wine from his flask 89 for your thirst would not be free, 90 except as water that does not flow into the sea.
query.result: 88 hwa ðe wiðsace ðone win of his fætlan 89 for ðinum þurste, ne wære he on freodome 90 buton swa wæter ðe on ðone sæ ne gelimpeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Tu vuo’ saper di quai piante s’infiora 92 questa ghirlanda che ’ntorno vagheggia 93 la bella donna ch’al ciel t’avvalora.
query.error: **English:** 91 You want to know of what plants this garland is made 92 that adorns the beautiful lady who exalts you to heaven.
query.result: 91 ðu woldest witan of hwylcum wyrtum ðeos weax 92 ðeos fægere wyrtgemynd ðe ðis fægere wif 93 ðe on heofonum ahefð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Io fui de li agni de la santa greggia 95 che Domenico mena per cammino 96 u’ ben s’impingua se non si vaneggia.
query.error: **English:** 94 I was one of the lambs of the holy flock 95 that Dominic leads along the way 96 where one grows fat if one does not stray.
query.result: 94 Ic wæs of ðæm lambum ðære halgan heorde 95 ðe Dominicus læt on ðam weg 96 ðær man wel geþyht gif man ne gedwæset.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Questi che m’è a destra più vicino, 98 frate e maestro fummi, ed esso Alberto 99 è di Cologna, e io Thomas d’Aquino.
query.error: **English:** 97 This one who is closest to me on the right, 98 was my brother and teacher, and he is Albert 99 of Cologne, and I am Thomas Aquinas.
query.result: 97 Þes þe me is on ðære swiðran healfe nehsta, 98 gebróðor and láreow wæs me, and he is Albert 99 of Cólónie, and ic Thomas of Aquino.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Se sì di tutti li altri esser vuo’ certo, 101 di retro al mio parlar ten vien col viso 102 girando su per lo beato serto.
query.error: **English:** 100 If you wish to be certain of all the others, 101 follow my words with your gaze, 102 turning around the blessed circle.
query.result: 100 Gif ðu ðonne wilt ðara oðerra ealra gewis wesan, 101 ðonne folga ðu minum wordum mid ðinum gesihðe, 102 begangende ðone eadigan serc.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Quell’ altro fiammeggiare esce del riso 104 di Grazïan, che l’uno e l’altro foro 105 aiutò sì che piace in paradiso.
query.error: **English:** 103 That other flaming issues from the smile 104 of Grace, who aided both of them 105 so that they are pleasing in paradise.
query.result: 103 Þæt oder liget ut of ðam hleahtre 104 Gratian, ðe him bæm ægðer gehiersumode, 105 swa ðæt him licað on ðam heofonlican rice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 L’altro ch’appresso addorna il nostro coro, 107 quel Pietro fu che con la poverella 108 offerse a Santa Chiesa suo tesoro.
query.error: **English:** 106 The other who adorns our choir next to him, 107 was that Peter who with the poor woman 108 offered his treasure to Holy Church.
query.result: 106 Se ðe oðer ðe ðær neh him ðone cor ðurhscineð, 107 se wæs Petrus se ðe mid ðære pearfan ðenunge 108 ðære halgan gelaðunge his goldhord sealde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 La quinta luce, ch’è tra noi più bella, 110 spira di tale amor, che tutto ’l mondo 111 là giù ne gola di saper novella:
query.error: **English:** 109 The fifth light, which is the most beautiful among us, 110 breathes forth such love that the whole world 111 down there thirsts to know the news:
query.result: 109 Se fifta leoht, ðe is us betst betwux, 110 spirað ðurh ðone lufe ðe al ðeos world 111 ðær niðer on ðære gretan gitsunge is:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 entro v’è l’alta mente u’ sì profondo 113 saver fu messo, che, se ’l vero è vero, 114 a veder tanto non surse il secondo.
query.error: **English:** 112 within it is the lofty mind in which such profound 113 knowledge was placed that, if the truth is true, 114 no one else has ever risen to see so much.
query.result: 112 ðær binnan is se heaha mod ðær ðæt swipe deope 113 ðæt wit on wæs set, ðæt ðe soð is soð, 114 ðæt næfre nan oder man ðærto ne aras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Appresso vedi il lume di quel cero 116 che giù in carne più a dentro vide 117 l’angelica natura e ’l ministero.
query.error: **English:** 115 Next you see the light of that candle 116 who, down in the flesh, saw most deeply 117 the angelic nature and its ministry.
query.result: 115 Æfter ðam ðu gesyhst ðæs leohtes leoman 116 ðe on lichaman niðor ma gecneow 117 ðone engliscan gecynd and ðæs geryne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Ne l’altra piccioletta luce ride 119 quello avvocato de’ tempi cristiani 120 del cui latino Augustin si provide.
query.error: **English:** 118 In the other small light laughs 119 that advocate of Christian times 120 from whose Latin Augustine provided himself.
query.result: 118 On ðære oðre lytlan leohte hliho 119 se rica dema ðara Cristenra daga 120 ðæs ðe his Læden Augustinus onfunde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Or se tu l’occhio de la mente trani 122 di luce in luce dietro a le mie lode, 123 già de l’ottava con sete rimani.
query.error: **English:** 121 Now if you, with the eye of your mind, 122 pass from light to light, following my praises, 123 you are already left with a thirst for the eighth sphere.
query.result: 121 Nu ðu ðinra gesceadra eagna gesihð 122 of leohte to leohte æfter minum lofe, 123 ðu eart ða ðæs eahtoðan ðyrstedig.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Per vedere ogne ben dentro vi gode 125 l’anima santa che ’l mondo fallace 126 fa manifesto a chi di lei ben ode.
query.error: **English:** 124 To see every good thing within it rejoices 125 the holy soul that makes the deceptive world 126 manifest to those who listen well to her.
query.result: 124 Tō geseonne ælce gōd ðærinne glædðeð 125 ðā hālgan sāwle ðe ðone wōhfullan weorold 126 ġecýðað ðæm ðe hīe wel gehýreð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Lo corpo ond’ ella fu cacciata giace 128 giuso in Cieldauro; ed essa da martiro 129 e da essilio venne a questa pace.
query.error: **English:** 127 The body from which she was expelled lies 128 down in Cieldauro; and she from martyrdom 129 and from exile came to this peace.
query.result: 127 Se lichaman of ðam heo aworpen wæs licð 128 niðer on Cieldauro; and heo of ðam gemartyrðum 129 and of ðam wræcside com to ðysum sibbe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Vedi oltre fiammeggiar l’ardente spiro 131 d’Isidoro, di Beda e di Riccardo, 132 che a considerar fu più che viro.
query.error: **English:** 130 You see beyond Isidore, Bede, and Richard 131 their ardent spirit flaming, 132 who was more than a man in contemplation.
query.result: 130 ðu gesyhst ðær ofer Isidorus and Beda and Riðhard, 131 ðara gastas on gaste glædum, 132 ðe wæron ðæs lifes ðurh ðone lifigendan God.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Questi onde a me ritorna il tuo riguardo, 134 è ’l lume d’uno spirto che ’n pensieri 135 gravi a morir li parve venir tardo:
query.error: **English:** 133 These waves return your gaze to me, 134 and are the light of a spirit who, in grave thoughts, 135 seemed to come slowly to death:
query.result: 133 Þas yða to me gewitað þin gesiho, 134 and is þæs leoht anes gastes þe on geþancum 135 hefigum to sweltanne him þuhte to læt:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 essa è la luce etterna di Sigieri, 137 che, leggendo nel Vico de li Strami, 138 silogizzò invidïosi veri».
query.error: **English:** 136 this is the eternal light of Siger, 137 who, reading in the Rue du Fouarre, 138 reasoned enviously true things.
query.result: 136 hit is seo ece leoht Sig(h)eres, 137 þe, rædende on þære strate Strami, 138 smeade andwyrde soð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Indi, come orologio che ne chiami 140 ne l’ora che la sposa di Dio surge 141 a mattinar lo sposo perché l’ami,
query.error: **English:** 139 Then, like a clock that calls us 140 at the hour when the bride of God rises 141 in the morning to her husband because he loves her,
query.result: 139 Þa, swa swa uhttid ðe us clipð 140 on ðære tide ðe Godes bryd ariseð 141 on mergen to hire gemacan for ðam ðe he hi lufiað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 che l’una parte e l’altra tira e urge, 143 tin tin sonando con sì dolce nota, 144 che ’l ben disposto spirto d’amor turge;
query.error: **English:** 142 which pulls and urges one part and the other, 143 sounding tin tin with such a sweet note, 144 that the well-disposed spirit swells with love;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 così vid’ ïo la gloriosa rota 146 muoversi e render voce a voce in tempra 147 e in dolcezza ch’esser non pò nota
query.error: **English:** 145 thus I saw the glorious wheel 146 move and render voice to voice in harmony 147 and in a sweetness that cannot be known
query.result: 145 swa ic ða geseah ða mæran hweol 146 styrian and stemne stemne on gemetgange 147 and on swetnesse ðe wesan ne mæg cuð

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 se non colà dove gioir s’insempra.
query.error: **English:** 148 except there where joy is sempiternal.
query.result: 148 buton ðær ðær gefean bið symle.
